main event: Multiple witnesses reported sighting a circular, silvery object in the sky over Bend and Gold Beach, Oregon on 24 May 1949.
interesting points: Witnesses used binoculars to observe the object, which appeared to be about 30-35 feet in diameter,The object was described as having a disc shape with a triangular fin,The object moved in a southerly direction, increasing speed and disappearing from sight after a few minutes,Some witnesses speculated the object might be made of thin metal or paper due to its appearance and movements,Investigations revealed no commercial air traffic in the area at the time of the sighting.
witness description: Residents and fishermen in the area
